item.title: Multiple Git Ssh Config Single Machine
item.description: To use multiple github account on same hosts, and using ssh to push and pull the repo. We have multiple tricks Using ssh config tricks with hosts: https://gist.github.com/JoaquimLey/e6049a12c8fd2923611802384cd2fb4a Used host trick before, but while setting up again and looking for documentation found this neat way using gitconfig. We can have to first set .gitconfig file in home directory. 1 2 3 4 5 6 [includeIf "gitdir:~/workspace/work/"] path = .

item.title: Post Your Startup
item.description: Compiled list of links from ‘Ask HN: Where can I post my startup to get beta users?’

item.title: Understanding Totp Format
item.description: Gist for TOTP is Secure share of shared-secret b/w parties via QR code, QR code is mostly and information in this url format: otpauth://totp/ACME%20Co:john.doe@email.com?secret=HXDMVJECJJWSRB3HWIZR4IFUGFTMXBOZ&issuer=ACME%20Co&algorithm=SHA1&digits=6&period=30 OTP = hash (shared secret + time) For deep dive, please go via bookmark reference mentioned on top

item.title: Use Money to Buy Time
item.description: If you have enough to get basic life go by(for needs not for greed), extra money should be used to buy time. Initially you need t sell your time to make money, once there, basic needs taken care of start using money to buy time. Tweet was inspired was Take every opportunity you get to use money to buy time, and then proceed to “waste” that extra time in doing things that cannot be bought for money.

item.description: Most beautiful part of day for me

item.title: Firefox Address Bar Tricks
item.description: Firefox provides easy way for searching the bookmarking, history or open tabs using the address bar. For searching bookmarks only Press Cmd/Ctrl + L Press * the search would come only for bookmarks. Similarly we can search for history, open tags or title using special character mentioned below 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 Add ^ to show only matches in your browsing history. Add * to show only matches in your bookmarks.

item.title: The Price of Becoming EXCEPTIONAL in Life Jordan Peterson Motivation
item.description: Wrote a note on Jordan-Peterson-Successful-Men-Are-Insane-And-Work-All-The-Time yesterday, and found similar video on the same topic. So youtube recommendation is smart, and I’m not the only one who made to stupid( like it though) conclusion. I’m ready to give that price, and become exceptional. Family do matter to me, friends to matter to me, but would keep the circle small and would focus on the goals that I have. Ready to give 80 hours work-week.

item.title: Novak Djokovic vs Roger Federer Wimbledon 2019 FullMatch
item.description: One more djo’s match, but was looking at federer who showed his metal at 36 yrs of age.

item.title: Jordan Peterson Successful Men Are Insane and Work All the Time
item.description: He said in one of his interviews that men wrote to him and told that he changed his life. I’m one of such characters. Here also a lot of thanks goes to people who made the internet happen, so I could watch his lessons/lectures or speeches. To achieve to be highly successful in corporate world i.e. reach at high position in social order one has to put insane amount of work, he mentioned 80 hours work week, translates to ~ 12 hours every day without breaks for years and with focus and determination.

item.title: Novak Djokovic vs Rafael Nadal in the Longest Final in Grand Slam History
item.description: If this can’t inspire anyone, not sure what could. These guys played for around ~ 6 hours, and that’s an incredible feat of achievement.

item.title: Nithin Kamath of Zerodha Says True Financial Freedom Is About Acquiring Skills First Than Money
item.description: This guy is simple to understand, no out of the world quotations. Can relate to him, seems like a neighbourhood elder brother(bhaiya) who you can talk to. What he mentioned was, spend on skills. More like one message in a 3-idiot movie. Run after excellence, success will come to you. He isn’t sadhu and adds on to say to buy material assets like cars or houses. If a house gives peace of mind, improves quality of life, go buy a house.

item.title: Hard Drive Failure Report Backblaze
item.description: It gives us of which hard drive to buy and which not as they are one of the biggest buyer of hard-driver and see those working at scale. As they mentioned Seagate ST16000NM001G has quite a high failure rate of 6.72% with backblaze so it would be wise to not buy that hard-drive.

item.title: Fake Reviews in Amazon
item.description: OP post from reddit thread First of all my background - I've been working on Amazon for years and know all the tricks of getting ranked. I do not engage in black hat tactics and I did the review game when it wasnt against TOS. As soon as they changed everything, I did not engage. However because of all my contacts I'm in the know for a lot of things.

item.title: Suprising Genius of 3D Printing Rockets
item.description: 3D printing is in nascent stages India, but seeing rocket being made out of this tech is so motivating and makes you look in future about possibility and how would it look like. Also thoughts come to mind, that why aren’t thing like electric 2-wheelers, drones, houses in India are using it, but then answer comes even more quickly, that people like are in jobs instead of innovating out there, so how would the change happen.

item.title: Leadership Lecture Sam Manekshaw
item.description: He believes leaders are not born, you can make a leaders out of man with reasonable common-sense and decency and rest of portion he then mentions attributes of leadership. Most of part is taken from summarized transcript by fellow youtuber at video with little changes from my side. According to manekshaw sir qualities of leader Professional competence : He provided example of Defence Minister who had no idea about howitzer, motor etc how can he lead the army officers !

item.title: Linux Load Avgs
item.description: Excerpt from blog post Linux load averages are “system load averages” that show the running thread (task) demand on the system as an average number of running plus waiting threads. This measures demand, which can be greater than what the system is currently processing. Most tools show three averages, for 1, 5, and 15 minutes: Some interpretations: If the averages are 0.0, then your system is idle. If the 1 minute average is higher than the 5 or 15 minute averages, then load is increasing.

Now most of it does, probably if I go for advanced study would really make sense.

item.description: Not sure how reached here, wasn’t actively looking for it but glad found it. Not a fan of bulky tracking websites, so this social little privacy-centric media buttons for reader and myself make ton of sense to me. Not a fan of twitter, but using twitter to reach out to people get feedback, improve ourselves, make myself better and this note is to remind myself why enabled this feature of social sharing in this site.

item.title: Bayes Rule and Medical Tests
item.description: All medical tests do is update their probability of having disease, and not tell if we have disease or not. There are three things Prevalence : How common is that disease around here? What chance of having it without tests? Sensitivity : If even disease is present, how good is the test at detecting it. Specificity : If a test is taken, there can be other issues that result. Clots in the pancreas can be because of a lot many things.

item.title: Lin Dan vs Lee Chong Wei
item.description: Seeing them together, playing with such skills is so beautiful. Love their game. Great video compilation too.

item.description: It’s is good to see fellow country man are working are making things are aircraft carrier, weighing 40000 tonnes in itself looks like huge engineering and manufacturing feat.

item.title: Bigger Impact of Distraction More Than Just Time Lost
item.description: Somehow reached to this tacky/clickbaity title “How the smartphone is destroying you from inside” https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4HjC245ugW8. Probably from the past few days, putting my head to these distractions. They seem to me like modern day alcoholic drinks. You enjoy it and forget your problems, similar promises made by alcoholic drinks. So the point video makes is, the time we invest in these addictive systems(there whole KPI is to make stay people on their website) is anyways gone, but there are more far reaching impact because of it.

item.title: Finally Some Sense in Laptops
item.description: It was good to see nice laptops coming in now. Which have this repairability in mind. This laptop specially looks with it’s modularity. As iFixit says, this is slippery slope, we have seen many such initiatives come and go. So hoping this company works and changes consumer electronics industry for good. Kudos to https://frame.work/ team.

item.title: NASA K8s Hardening Guide
item.description: Main highlights as mentioned by top commentator Scan containers and Pods for vulnerabilities or misconfigurations. Run containers and Pods with the least privileges possible. Use network separation to control the amount of damage a compromise can cause. Use firewalls to limit unneeded network connectivity and encryption to protect confidentiality. Use strong authentication and authorization to limit user and administrator access as well as to limit the attack surface.

item.title: Golang Slice Tricks
item.description: Filtering with allocating This trick uses the fact that a slice shares the same backing array and capacity as the original, so the storage is reused for the filtered slice. Of course, the original contents are modified. 1 2 3 4 5 6 b := a[:0] for _, x := range a { if f(x) { b = append(b, x) } }

item.title: What Is Not Love
item.description: This youtube video(click the title, that is how bookmarks are arranged for all posts), is of Abraham Joshua Heshel Twerski, an Israeli-American Hasidic rabbi, a scion of the Chernobyl Hasidic dynasty, and a psychiatrist specializing in substance abuse. External-love is what I’m going to give, not what I’m going to get. (This line is bit vague) I good line that i need to keep in check is: “People make serious mistake in thinking, that you give to those who you love, and the answer is you love to those whom you give” His point is, if I give something to you, I have invested myself in you, since self-love is given everybody loves themselves, now that part of me has become in you, there is part of me in you that I love.

item.title: Profiles to Look Upto
item.description: Time to time, few profiles come across to me, which I see and admire of, the amount of work they have done. The position they are in, the impact they are making. Seeing their profiles motivates me. These profile answer age old interview question for me: Where do you see youself in 3-5 years ? His readme is beautiful, simple and succint. His github is clean. Motivated me also collect those badges(certifications), never a certification guy, but those badges are looking cool.

item.title: Flamenco Street Music
item.description: Was listening to thismusic in college, today there was discussion and flamenco again came up. It was sweet memory lane to go and also happy to see this video is still there in youtube. How intrusive youtube-ads are, but is does provide value of society. Not sure if we have any way to store music forever like we have books for text.

item.title: People Do Not Care
item.description: You get up every morning. You show up. You do the right things. You work really really hard. Don’t cheat, don’t steal, don’t beg, don’t lie. Here is the honest truth – People don’t care! People don’t care if you are doing the right thing. They only care if you are doing the right thing for them. tldr : If they care they care, if they don’t they don’t and that shouldn’t be once concern.

item.title: Linus Interview Linuxcon North America 2016
item.description: Linus interviews are always fun to watch. One of favorite past-time activity for me. Loved watching it. Keeping them here. One good comment mentioned one simple/funny thing in interview in early MVP version of linux the disk sectors were hard coded

item.description: Projector and optics personally is very facinating like astrology to me. Playing with light, was never fun and understanding when i was in school, but now I just love it, and also understanding how things work at the same time. Here Matt beautifully shows internals of optics in projector.

item.title: Video: A glimpse into ancient indian astronomy
item.description: Astrology has always intrigued me, specifically indian style of astrology, have heard a lot about it. Lunar calendar and rituals and traditions around it always facinate me a lot. I have some longing for it. Haven’t worked on it much, but this video again brings those question back to me. Path for me is language first, will have to learn sanskrit first, then i would have lot of venues open to me.

item.description: He has made beautiful and optimized site, exactly how work should be like.

item.title: Federation Is Worst of All Worlds
Why Normalize CSS
item.description: Normalize.css is a small CSS file that provides better cross-browser consistency in the default styling of HTML elements. It’s a modern, HTML5-ready, alternative to the traditional CSS reset. The aims of normalize.css are as follows: Preserve useful browser defaults rather than erasing them. Normalize styles for a wide range of HTML elements. Correct bugs and common browser inconsistencies. Improve usability with subtle improvements. Explain the code using comments and detailed documentation.

item.title: Learning to Write With Confidencce
item.description: Some notes Writing is Thinking “Self-doubt can be an ally. This is because it serves as an indicator of aspiration. It reflects love, love of something we dream of doing, and desire, desire to do it. If you find yourself asking yourself (and your friends), “Am I really a writer? Am I really an artist?” chances are you are.” - The War of Art “Each time you write a page, you are a writer.

item.title: Sell Yourself, Sell Your Work
item.description: Few notes Doing technically brilliant work may be enough for your personal gratification, but you should never think it’s enough. If you lock yourself in a room and do the most marvellous work but don’t tell anyone, then no one will know, no one will benefit, and the work will be lost. You may as well not have bothered. For the world to benefit from your work, and therefore for you to benefit fully from your work, you have to make it known.
